titles: The cavaleers complaint. To the tune of, I tell thee Dick, &c.
publisher: Printed for Robert Crofts at the Crown in Chancery-lane,
notes: An edition of "The cavalier's complaint", first published in 1660.
Verse - "Come Jack, let's drink a pot of ale,".
Annotation on Thomason copy: "march 16 1660"; the second 1 in the imprint date has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Charles II, 1660-1685 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
